Developer Grumm_ was asked about a lighting engine update and he said it would be "soon." I don't think the minor internal changes are all we're getting.
This would not be difficult with tables. The tables already exist.
I think that is a wonderful idea! The lighting has not changed since the game hit Beta. I do think it's time for some upgrades for the lighting.
DirectX is nice, but it would run even slower. There was a post in the second or third page that wants Vulkan for rendering, and Vulkan is the fastest rendering API of all of them.
java performs very poorly! directx or vulkan would totally change the performance of the game
Vulkan plz

385731322111 It's a tad wrong to say OpenGL or DX are "slower" or "faster" because performance is entirely up to the programmer. Vulkan isn't "faster" per se but it is a WHOLE lot more low level so it can be faster since lower-level programming allows more control over optimization.

The problem with using directx is that minecraft java is designed to be platform compatible, which directx isnt. Also minecraft java uses lwjgl which only includes opengl and vulkan. This is probably why if you want a better rendering engine in minecraft, the two options are newer opengl or vulkan. Vulkan would take more work but, if done well, yield tons more performance, especially for amd graphics card users on windows.
Bad idea, this would remove official Linux/macOS compatibility. (Surprisingly, MC java is more stable on Linux most of the time as well.)
vulkan would be the fastest and is the best api to use because it is crossplatform and runs on everything like a phone switch and all Desktop operating systems

NO. this is impossible because LWJGL doesn't have directx, GLFW doesn't have directx, and Java Edition isn't windows-only (thankfully). it's not true that "Java only supports OpenGL", it doesn't support any rendering API, but a framework called LWJGL allows java to use OpenGL, Vulkan (which it should use instead), GLFW (for creating windows and keyboard/mouse/gamepad input), OpenAL (for audio) and more.
openGL = crap
Or vulkan

I think the big things I would want changed are the number/types of limbs; the forward facing eyes; and the weird maw it has.

I would love this to be done, having Squids updated to look and act more like the real animal would do wonders for the ocean biome, the MC Squid IMO really looks out of place compared to all the other aquatic mobs, giving a more real squid look would alleviate that. Perhaps the model could be based on the real Humboldt Squid (image below), a deep-sea animal of a similar size to that of the squid that currently exists in Minecraft
I would especially love it if the squid no longer spawned in freshwater environments. Making it so that ink sacs can only be found in the seas gives us more reason to go there, and IMO there's never enough reasons to explore the oceans.

Perhaps the existing squid model (with a new texture) could still be used for an octopus mob though, it's already about the size of some larger octopus species, like the seven-arm octopus, and the giant pacific octopus (of course this mob too would be ocean exclusive, maybe squids spawn more commonly in deep water and octopi spawn more often in the shallows?).

I feel like render distance shouldn't cap at all based on device, I play on mobile and after caves and cliffs the render distance cap was decreased from 32 chunks to 9 chunks (even if each chunk is roughly twice as large now, that math still doesn't make sense), and the game is much harder to play now because I can barely see. It would make more sense if the render distance cap was the same on all devices, but came with a warning for putting it over the recommended settings.

385763760092 That's an option on the Bedrock character creator.

I may not have alot of knowledge on the reasonings of Mojang and/or Microsoft, but I will say this. When they added updates like the one that added the character creator, they discretely said that each Minecraft platform will have its own features and some will not be crossed over to the other platform. They try to balance the platfoms by adding some exclusive features that are not common throughout all the platforms. For instance, Minecraft Java has the ability to enchant shields. In return, Minecraft Bedrock got an update that added the character creator. It may have been a little while of a delay to return the favor to Minecraft Bedrock, but they got to it. And also, this is a theory, but since Minecraft Bedrock is on consoles and mobile devices, it is somewhat harder to create skins pixel by pixel. So they added the character creator exclusively to Minecraft Bedrock. I know some of this stuff is not all true, but I am basing this off of my knowledge of Minecraft's platform balancing. 

If this solved your issue, I am pleased it did.

Have a great day!

Yours Truly,

This NEEDS to be apporved

It will take so much time to migrate the graphics engine to Metal 3 (no cost-benefits from my POV), besides it will drag many bugs on the process and newer content will be delayed. Apple its the principal culprit here to deprecate the newer versions of OpenGL for MacOS & iOS ecosystems. I'd suggest to try this type of migration with the Bedrock Edition cause they've change the render engine to Render Dragon, who knows maybe it will be available for MacOS and Linux systems coming soon.

While Mojang/Microsoft is more likely to use Metal APIs in Bedrock if they ever bring that to Mac (or at least implement it for iOS & iPadOS), the improvements in Metal 3 might make translation layers like MoltenVK or MoltenGL more functional, and thus useful, for Java edition. This would be more likely to be implemented by things like shader mods and alternative launchers than Mojang itself though, I would expect.

It would be hard, but they just need a dedicated team for optimisations. And it's good to support it for Mac as more people are switching to Apple Silicon Macs even from Windows because the performance per watt. They also don't need to rush this and slowly do it.

Also with the latest version of LWJGL they should be able to do it.
good idea!
